Lori Loughlin and husband agree to plead guilty in college admissions scandal caseHollywood star Lori Loughlin and her fashion designer husband will plead guilty Friday to conspiracy charges for paying bribes totaling $500,000 to get their daughters into the University of Southern California as phony crew recruits, legal filings show, capping one of the most closely watched cases in the nationwide “Varsity Blues” college admissions scandal.

YVONNE ABRAHAMAsking too much of workersOf course, we can’t shut down indefinitely.  But let’s not kid ourselves about who is bearing the burden for our return to relative normalcy in this pandemic.

Men are taking on (slightly) more household chores amid the coronavirus pandemicA new survey presents a glass-half-full perspective on the division of labor at home: Yes, men are doing less than women when they’re shut in at home, but they’re doing more than they were before the coronavirus pandemic.

For workers over 65, nothing says you’re old like a stay-at-home advisoryGovernor Charlie Baker issued  a new “safer at home advisory" this week — “not an order,” he was quick to say — asking employees 65 or older or those with underlying health conditions to remain in lockdown as their colleagues begin returning to the workplace.
